page.title: 13ASLACKBY-BUILD. & EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Farm now occupies the area. The Medieval Manor house (with Queen Anne and Victorian additions) and the beautiful Medieval Church are all connected to each other,and to Temple Farm by underground passages. The Robin Hood Inn describes itself as an 18th century drinking house. The Chapel was erected in 1903. Services are held, but not regularly. Jumble sales and fairs are held to finance it. {EMPLOYMENT A sheet metal factory is situated on the A15 main road, just on the left as you descend into the village. Up Kirkby Underwood road is a blacksmiths who shoes horses and employs an agricultural engineer. Many farmers from surrounding villages come here for minor repairs to their implements. It is always busy. There
